page.title: 05Farming Gt.Asby,Eden Valley
page.content: FARMING Around here most farmers have animals and pasture land.Apart from grass there is little arable farming.There is more silage than hay made because it is more economical. Swaledales are the most common sheep.Quite a few farmers breed mules (Leicester x Swaledale sheep).A few people have Jacobs and quite a lot have Leicesters.In Summer there are many agricultural shows for people to take their best animals,poultry and produce to display. Sometimes there are sheepdog trials. Horse riding has become very popular recently and you see ponies in fields.Although most farmers own their own farms, a few are rented.It is unusual in this area for more than two workers to be employed, as nearly all the farms are small family businesses.
